heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 17 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (200°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.4°C) and outside temperature (down 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 5969 lux) and cloud levels (up 132 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm), light levels (up 3154 lux), and cloud levels (up 434 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 132.1m lower than yesterday, 178.0m higher than the past week, 433.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 702m to 2980m and averaged 1465.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, a muggy, humid atmosphere is likely and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
